channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: A YouTuber who investigates cold cases found the car of two Tennessee teenagers who went missing 21 years ago submerged in a river. It's at least the fourth discovery by amateur investigators in two months. https://t.co/A5XCWh8kqf

Michael Nesmith, the contemplative, wool-cap-wearing member of the Monkees, has died at 78. He made one of the rock era's first music videos and won the first Grammy Award for video. https://t.co/Ed2OuEMfqr https://t.co/8PssCI3xfu

Planet earth is getting its own 'black box.' It will create an archive that could be critical to piecing together the missteps, its creators say, should humanity be destroyed by climate change. https://t.co/vdHNLzj5d1
Breaking News: A British court ruled that Julian Assange can be extradited to the U.S. to face espionage charges. The WikiLeaks founder can appeal the verdict. https://t.co/cA8V8Ck9ho
"Our Santa was Black, but to young me he wasn’t Black Santa. He was simply Santa, no adjective required," writes the author Nancy Redd. https://t.co/P6T04GXzMH https://t.co/wJMVvoxxZs

A Texas judge found that the approach unconstitutionally granted standing to those who were not injured, denied due process and represented an "unlawful delegation of enforcement power to a private person." https://t.co/I8C2X403wD

Demaryius Thomas, a former star wide receiver for the Denver Broncos who played for the NFL for 10 seasons before retiring in June, died at his home in Georgia on Thursday. He was 33. https://t.co/pMKprmJPOC

Birds Aren’t Real is a parody social movement with a purpose, its creators say — and Gen Z’s attempt to fight and poke fun at misinformation. "My favorite way to describe the organization is fighting lunacy with lunacy," one organizer said. https://t.co/aHJ7d65e4g

A steel vault, known as Earth’s Black Box, will be put in a remote part of Australia. It will create an archive that could be critical to piecing together the missteps, its creators say, should humanity be destroyed by climate change. https://t.co/9K4kcISthc

Although Congress has allocated trillions of dollars to combat the pandemic, no initiatives exist specifically to help the tens of thousands of children who have lost parents or caregivers.
A bipartisan group is urging White House officials to do more. https://t.co/3zV1UBVoEh

The finding is "another wake-up call for the medical profession and public health to look more deeply into the issues of overweight and obese individuals, and the treatments and vaccines we’re giving them," said one professor of nutrition. https://t.co/iEckimA4WQ https://t.co/SNAI3S1htS
Your reading list just got a lot longer — here are the 10 Best Books of 2021, selected by editors at The New York Times Book Review. https://t.co/q64VjYqj4v https://t.co/5TlR6Yoyl9
Breaking News: An appeals court ruled that Congress may see White House records of Donald Trump’s communications and movements related to the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol. https://t.co/jsRdpxL00L
Breaking News: New York passed a bill allowing noncitizens who are legally in the country to vote in local elections, becoming the largest U.S. city to do so. https://t.co/PoDiftizHg

Prolonged grief disorder has been added to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, as experts predict a wave of severe bereavement because of the pandemic. It affects around 7% of those in mourning, preliminary studies suggest. https://t.co/7mnEm5SQfw https://t.co/Y72Ld6FrMg

Breaking News: Starbucks workers at a store in Buffalo voted to unionize, making it the only company-owned store in the U.S. with a union. Votes at two other Buffalo-area stores will be counted later on Thursday. https://t.co/cjMYJHpuwc

Josh Duggar, a onetime star of the TLC reality show "19 Kids and Counting," was convicted on Thursday on federal charges of downloading child sexual abuse imagery. He faces a maximum penalty of 40 years in prison and $500,000 in fines. https://t.co/3Jqj2EBvXk
Breaking News: The FDA authorized Pfizer boosters for 16- and 17-year-olds, clearing the way for several million teenagers to get an additional shot. https://t.co/wDpzzHOQlN https://t.co/iiz0hZRAEb

Birds Aren’t Real is a parody social movement with a purpose, its creators say — and Gen Z’s attempt to fight and poke fun at misinformation. "My favorite way to describe the organization is fighting lunacy with lunacy," one organizer said. https://t.co/FkGjBxwwNc https://t.co/ALeuTHT2f8
Breaking News: The Metropolitan Museum of Art announced that the Sackler name would be removed from seven exhibition spaces over the family’s ties to the opioid crisis. https://t.co/NFV3dHv4kO
New Zealand plans to eventually ban all cigarette sales, gradually raising the smoking age until it covers its entire population. https://t.co/9bPGRgQqf8
Breaking News: New York’s attorney general subpoenaed Donald Trump to testify in a civil fraud inquiry into his business practices. https://t.co/WDVJ2iqhx2

"In this lesson, I’m going to face one of my most public defeats head-on by sharing with you the speech I had hoped to deliver if I had won the 2016 election," Hillary Clinton said in a MasterClass video. "I’ve never shared this with anybody." https://t.co/TfigRB6rTl

"I was seeing intimate, long-lost footage of the world’s most famous band preparing for its final performance," writes @amandahess of "The Beatles: Get Back."
"And I couldn’t stop watching Yoko Ono sitting around, doing nothing." https://t.co/vhg7YCDPVL

In Opinion
“With every shift, I see the strain people sick with Covid-19 put on my hospital,” writes Rob Davidson, an emergency physician in a rural area of West Michigan, in a guest essay. “Their choice to not get vaccinated is not personal.” https://t.co/Hcc0lBAi93
New Zealand unveiled a plan to eventually ban all sales of cigarettes in the country. Starting in 2023, anyone under age 15 would be barred for life from buying cigarettes. https://t.co/PWZEb7hevb

Hillary Clinton read her discarded victory speech from the 2016 election aloud for her offering on MasterClass, a site featuring lessons from prominent figures in the arts, business and other fields. https://t.co/WeOL1VISnq
Your reading list just got a lot longer — here are the 10 Best Books of 2021, selected by editors at The New York Times Book Review. https://t.co/RPIixIOQfw https://t.co/WF6AOTRZJE
Active shooter drills in schools may harm the mental health of students while doing little to prevent mass shootings, some experts say. https://t.co/4YwuncCHJH

President Biden unveiled a plan on Wednesday to make the federal government carbon neutral by 2050, ordering federal agencies to buy electric vehicles, to power facilities with wind, solar and nuclear energy, and to use sustainable building materials. https://t.co/piSpwkMtJ9 https://t.co/0NLNXkVCkt
The coronavirus can infect body fat, scientists said. The research may explain why people who are overweight or obese face greater risk of severe illness and death from Covid. https://t.co/43d6OO2SAz
The bride walked down the aisle. The groom's buddy made a toast. There was dancing at the reception. And it all happened in the metaverse. https://t.co/QytfKWqZoh https://t.co/zZevD7vD6g

Breaking News: President Biden ordered that federal vehicles and buildings begin transitioning to renewable energy, with the goal of making the government carbon neutral by 2050. https://t.co/4BZlMI2b2F

The assault of a French soccer player made headlines, with masked men, a metal bar and a teammate arrested.
But as details emerge about infidelity, accusations against other players and reports of menacing phone calls, no one is sure what to believe. https://t.co/MPTEgWidEw
A 50-foot-tall Christmas tree outside the Fox News headquarters in New York City went up in flames. One man has been arrested, the police said. https://t.co/dYeIAvMA5A

When Angela Merkel became chancellor 16 years ago, George W. Bush was in the White House and Tony Blair was prime minister of Britain. There was no Twitter and no iPhone.
Here is a look back at pictures from her time at the helm. https://t.co/FdBHqMDCPI
Behold the fearsome Tyrannosaurus rex — all swaddled in a cozy Christmas sweater. 🦖 https://t.co/dORyq1oVLh

Olaf Scholz’s swearing in as Germany’s chancellor made one change to a well-practiced protocol: He omitted the final four words — “so help me God” — of the traditional oath, a first for a postwar chancellor. https://t.co/xFUIyGw6BO

A book by Billie Eilish cost her publisher well over $1 million. But it sold only about 64,000 hardcover copies since it came out in May, highlighting the difficulty in predicting how well a book will sell. https://t.co/a3XGSx7XbH

The T. rex at London’s Natural History Museum is a ferocious-looking beast. It’s now wearing a cozy Christmas sweater.
“There is nothing more funny than a jumper fitted for a dinosaur that has the tiniest arms in the world,” one employee said. https://t.co/leHawmXrjZ https://t.co/z1VNUJlZVi

Three doses of Pfizer-BioNTech’s Covid vaccine give significant protection against Omicron, the companies said, but two doses alone “may not be sufficient to protect against infection” by the fast-spreading variant. https://t.co/EsNTB7Jhu4 https://t.co/VAjT2vK5he

The U.S. surgeon general on Tuesday warned that young people are facing “devastating” mental health effects as a result of the challenges experienced by their generation, including the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/82JnA4Gc7G

A dominant era of German politics is ending today as Angela Merkel hands over the chancellery to Olaf Scholz, a Social Democrat with ambitions to revive progressive politics across Europe.
Follow live updates. https://t.co/Jv8lOvchGq

As manatee deaths spike and Florida rescue centers fill up with malnourished manatees, federal and state wildlife officials are taking an unprecedented step: They will provide food for hundreds of manatees in an urgent effort to get them through the winter.https://t.co/F39H7tODNA

Ghislaine Maxwell has called the Metropolitan Detention Center "a living hell," but the judge overseeing her trial on sex trafficking and conspiracy charges has denied bail her four times, saying Maxwell poses "a substantial actual risk of flight." https://t.co/F0BdgOlHLi

Saule Omarova, a Cornell Law professor whom President Biden picked for a key banking regulator job, is withdrawing from consideration for the post. Bank lobbyists and Republicans painted her as a communist because she was born in the Soviet Union. https://t.co/90ShBjM5WX

The U.S. surgeon general warned on Tuesday that young people are facing "devastating" mental health effects as a result of the challenges experienced by their generation, including the pandemic. https://t.co/ZLXK5YzIAN https://t.co/MU3O4fwuIJ

Charlottesville's Robert E. Lee statue, which was the focus of a deadly white nationalist rally in 2017, will be donated to an African American heritage center that plans to melt it down and create "art that will reflect racial justice and inclusion." https://t.co/vhDc43INJr https://t.co/lgj8mSlkQO

Charlottesville's Robert E. Lee statue, which was the focus of a deadly white nationalist rally in 2017, will be donated to an African American heritage center that plans to melt it down and create "art that will reflect racial justice and inclusion." https://t.co/j2bmy7frSl
Merck and Pfizer will soon debut prescription pills to treat Covid-19 that are expected to work against all versions of the virus. And more drugs are on the way. https://t.co/jOX6Md08gx
